document_title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 10 for SLE 15 SP4)

document_notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 10 for SLE 15 SP4)
document_notes.title: Topic

document_notes.text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 5.14.21-150400_24_55 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2023-1652: Fixed use-after-free that could lead to DoS and information leak in nfsd4_ssc_setup_dul in fs/nfsd/nfs4proc.c (bsc#1209788).
document_notes.title: Details

relationship.relates_to_product_reference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Live Patching 15 SP4

notes.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in nfsd4_ssc_setup_dul in fs/nfsd/nfs4proc.c in the NFS filesystem in the Linux Kernel. This issue could allow a local attacker to crash the system or it may lead to a kernel information leak problem.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
